modName: Nightingale Drizzt Armor - inspired by Lockwood
summary: Nightingale retexture inspired by Lockwood\'s design for Drizzt Do\'Urden\'s armor...
descriptionHtml:
Another retexture of the Nightingale armor, this time I was trying to make it look similar to Lockwood\'s design for Drizzt Do\'Urden\'s armor. I\'d recommend you use a faceless Nightingale mod if using the hood. 

P.S. - I don\'t know how, but would love to see a mod that gives more skin color options. The darkest skin tone on the Dark elves just doesn\'t seem black enough for a Drow!? AND purple eyes for the dark elves :)

I\'ve yet to try any 3d modeling, so this is as close as I can get with retexturing only... couldn\'t do the white fur scarf/cloak. I\'m new at this! 
Started with the Nightingale Prime texture but changed it drastically. Added a leather texture to overall armor and smoothed out texture on cape. Colored as I saw fit.

As always, I welcome any suggestions for changes/improvements.

Credits:
-> Tod Lockwood \"inspired\" design. ...not really close enough to actually need permissions...

-> Nightingale Prime HD Armor - author?? (has been taken off the Nexus I think?)

Installation:
Simply extract the Data folder in the Skyrim folder.
Typically:
C:/Program Files/Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim
or
C:/Program Files (x86)/Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim
author: Roman Nagy
